title: What are some beautiful examples of patterns in nature? - Quora

response.answer_text: Birds flying    Fishes    Human teeth  human eye  human finger  pattern hair style  Fish teeth  Bismuth is a chemical element with symbol Bi and atomic number 83. Bismuth, a pentavalent poor metal, chemically resembles arsenic and antimony. Elemental bismuth may occur naturally, although its sulfide and oxide form important commercial ores. The free element is 86% as dense as lead. It is a brittle metal with a silvery white color when freshly produced, but is often seen in air with a pink tinge owing to surface oxidation.  Corn   At 2.27 metres (7ft 5in) high, the Amorphophallus titanum is considered the largest flower in the world. Yup! It smells terrible.  Physalis alkekengi, or the Chinese/Japanese Lantern, blooms during Winter and dries during Spring. Once it is dried, the bright red fruit is seen. The outer cover is a thin mesh that held the flower petals, seen in golden brown colour.  Priotrochatella (Cuban Land Snail)  From a Violent Collision Comes Celestial Beauty – Amber inclusions of olivine in meteorite..  Koroit Opal – Found In Australia, South West Queensland.   Flying fish can make powerful, self-propelled leaps out of water into air, where their long, wing-like fins enable gliding flight for considerable distances above the water’s surface. This uncommon ability is a natural defense mechanism to evade predators.

Nature is an intricately designed pattern. Science cannot explain them fully even after millions of years of human existence. If the most intelligent creature on earth cannot explain a pattern of nature, then nature must be more intelligent than humans? Lets see through these examples: A nerka salmon (fish) takes birth in fresh water, lives in freshwater lake for 3 years of its life. Suddenly, as if it cannot help itself, moves to sea water traveling over 1000 miles through waterfalls, rivers, and ultimately in pacific ocean. After living there for another 2 years, something changes in its head & it heads back to its place of birth! On way back, it eats more than it should until it crosses back from ocean to river. Climbs back up the same waterfalls it had come down from & ultimately reaching back to its place of birth. Once it is there, it looks for a partner & they lay eggs there. Because they do not eat anything once back in fresh water & tired from the return journey, it loses its life!! Isnt it amazing that a fish can remember the exact route after living so far, can adjust itself twice to fresh water to sea water to fresh water. Annually kenya & tanzania region witness migration of 1mn+ animal species - mostly wildebeest, zebras & antelopes. this is how it looks like. they travel the same route year on year almost circling around in search for easier climate & food. a human pair can produce ~84,00,000 types of child. Genes are a complex thread and contains answers to all that we do in life. Yet, we do not know anything about them
